texts: Artificial intelligence is transforming how we process and understand information. Machine learning algorithms can identify patterns in large datasets that would be impossible for humans to detect manually.
Natural language processing enables computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language. This technology powers chatbots, translation services, and content analysis tools.
Deep learning models use neural networks with multiple layers to solve complex problems. These models excel at tasks like image recognition, speech processing, and language understanding.
Data science combines statistics, programming, and domain expertise to extract insights from data. It involves collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and visualizing data to support decision-making.
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) combines the power of large language models with external knowledge sources. This approach improves the accuracy and relevance of generated responses.
Vector databases store and retrieve high-dimensional embeddings efficiently. They enable semantic search and similarity matching for applications like recommendation systems and document retrieval.
Embedding models convert text into numerical vectors that capture semantic meaning. These vectors can be used to measure similarity between different pieces of text.
Chunking strategies determine how large documents are split into smaller, manageable pieces. Different approaches include fixed-size, semantic, and sentence-based chunking.
Similarity search finds the most relevant chunks based on vector distance metrics. Common approaches include cosine similarity, dot product, and Euclidean distance.
Context window management is crucial for language models with limited input capacity. Effective strategies include truncation, summarization, and selective chunk inclusion.
